div.class: makeTableResponsive img-responsive no-border col-md-9 col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-push-0
div.p: The United Independent School District is closely monitoring the novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) and is in contact with the City of Laredo Health Department to ensure all students and staff members are safe and updated with the latest information from the Center for Disease Control, Texas Health and Human Services, and Texas Education Agency.
Please know that United ISD has opened a call center to assist the community with any questions regarding COVID19 and the impact it had on any UISD Event.

ul.li: Hours of Operation: M-F 8 AM to 4 PM

div.p: United ISD is working diligently to meet your children's academic needs. The district wants to assure parents, students, and our community that student/staff safety and learning are our top priorities. As such, the district will be transitioning into an Online Learning Platform - Google Classroom effective Monday, April 6, 2020.
div.h2: United ISD Grab and Go Meals Information
div.p: Beginning Monday, March 23rd, drive-through food distribution will be offered at select school sites across the District. Meals kits will be provided to any child 18 years old and younger. Each meal kit will include breakfast and lunch and will be distributed at the front parking area of each school site on a drive-through basis.

u.a: NO CHILD PRESENT MEAL PICKUP FLEXIBILITY - English | Spanish

div.p: View Sites - English | Español | View Breakfast Menu | View Lunch Menu | More Information

Out of an abundance of caution, the United ISD Tax Office will be closed to the public through May 4. Taxes can be paid online or via mail. If you have any questions please contact the United ISD call center at 956-473-8000.
*Taxes can be paid online via the link above. Payments can be made by credit/debit card with a 3% service charge or paid with eCheck with a $1.00 service charge.
Pay taxes via mail with money order or check to: 3501 E. Saunders Laredo, Texas 78041

u.span: EXTENDED DISTRICT CLOSURE THROUGH END OF ACADEMIC YEAR BY EXECUTIVE ORDER OF GOVERNOR GREG ABBOTT

div.p: United ISD’s closure will be extended to the end of the academic year, initially scheduled for May 28, 2020, as per Texas Governor Gregg Abbott’s Executive Order. Students and parents should continue to follow through with the assignments and instructional materials provided on the remote online instructional program.

hr.p: Good mental health is critical to children’s success in school and life. Mental health is not simply the absence of mental illness but also encompasses social, emotional and behavioral health and the ability to cope with life’s challenges. Here are some resources to support mental health.
Here are some frequently asked questions we have been receiving.

Stop The Spread Of Germs - Spanish

div.p: We inspire all students to become responsible world citizens by pursuing excellence through life-long learning
